atDirectives.name: @apply
atDirectives.description: Use the `@apply` directive to inline any existing utility classes into your own custom CSS.

atDirectives.name: @variant
atDirectives.description: Use the `@variant` directive to apply a Tailwind variant (like `hover`, `focus`, `dark`, etc.) to styles in your CSS.

atDirectives.name: @custom-variant
atDirectives.description: Use the `@custom-variant` directive to define your own custom variant (e.g. theme-based), enabling utilities like `theme-midnight:bg-black`.

atDirectives.name: @config
atDirectives.description: Use the `@config` directive to load a legacy JavaScript-based Tailwind config file within a CSS context.

atDirectives.name: @plugin
atDirectives.description: Use the `@plugin` directive to load a legacy JavaScript-based Tailwind plugin (e.g. `@tailwindcss/typography`).

atDirectives.name: @utility
atDirectives.description: Use the @utility directive to add custom utilities to your project that work with variants like hover, focus and lg:

atDirectives.name: --spacing()
atDirectives.description: Use the `--spacing()` function to generate a spacing value based on your theme's `--spacing` variable, resolving to `calc(var(--spacing) * <n>)`.

atDirectives.name: --alpha()
atDirectives.description: Use the `--alpha()` function to adjust a colors opacity, which compiles to `color-mix()` internally.
